comment:
* A simple set of metadata for a media item suitable for display. This can be
 * created using the Builder or retrieved from existing metadata using
 * {@link MediaMetadata#getDescription()}.

variables.name: mMediaId
variables.comment: * A unique persistent id for the content or null.

variables.name: mTitle
variables.comment: * A primary title suitable for display or null.

variables.name: mSubtitle
variables.comment: * A subtitle suitable for display or null.

variables.name: mDescription
variables.comment: * A description suitable for display or null.

variables.name: mIcon
variables.comment: * A bitmap icon suitable for display or null.

variables.name: mIconUri
variables.comment: * A Uri for an icon suitable for display or null.

variables.name: mExtras
variables.comment: * Extras for opaque use by apps/system.

variables.name: mMediaUri
variables.comment: * A Uri to identify this content.

variables.name: EXTRA_BT_FOLDER_TYPE
variables.comment:
* Used as a long extra field to indicate the bluetooth folder type of the media item as * specified in the section 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5. This is valid only for * {@link MediaBrowser.MediaItem} with {@link MediaBrowser.MediaItem#FLAG_BROWSABLE}. The value * should be one of the following: *
    *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_MIXED}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_TITLES}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_ALBUMS}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_ARTISTS}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_GENRES}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_PLAYLISTS}
    • *
  • {@link #BT_FOLDER_TYPE_YEARS}
    • *
* * @see #getExtras()

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_MIXED
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that is unknown or contains media elements of mixed types as specified in
     * the section 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_TITLES
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains media elements only as specified in the section 6.10.2.2 of
     * the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_ALBUMS
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains folders categorized by album as specified in the section
     * 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_ARTISTS
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains folders categorized by artist as specified in the section
     * 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_GENRES
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains folders categorized by genre as specified in the section
     * 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_PLAYLISTS
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains folders categorized by playlist as specified in the section
     * 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

variables.name: BT_FOLDER_TYPE_YEARS
variables.comment:
* The type of folder that contains folders categorized by year as specified in the section
     * 6.10.2.2 of the Bluetooth AVRCP 1.5.

methods.name: public String getMediaId()
methods.comment:
* Returns the media id or null. See
     * {@link MediaMetadata#METADATA_KEY_MEDIA_ID}.

methods.name: public CharSequence getTitle()
methods.comment:
* Returns a title suitable for display or null.
     *
     * @return A title or null.

methods.name: public CharSequence getSubtitle()
methods.comment:
* Returns a subtitle suitable for display or null.
     *
     * @return A subtitle or null.

methods.name: public CharSequence getDescription()
methods.comment:
* Returns a description suitable for display or null.
     *
     * @return A description or null.

methods.name: public Bitmap getIconBitmap()
methods.comment:
* Returns a bitmap icon suitable for display or null.
     *
     * @return An icon or null.

methods.name: public Uri getIconUri()
methods.comment:
* Returns a Uri for an icon suitable for display or null.
     *
     * @return An icon uri or null.

methods.name: public Bundle getExtras()
methods.comment:
* Returns any extras that were added to the description.
     *
     * @return A bundle of extras or null.

methods.name: public Uri getMediaUri()
methods.comment:
* Returns a Uri representing this content or null.
     *
     * @return A media Uri or null.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
